result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morris D Davis

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:44 am 
INCLUDES 22CF125 AND 22CF600. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person with Atty Adam Fontana.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 22CF125: Ct. 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CF600: Cts. 1 - 3>>D&RI. 
Uncharged DA's Case 22MA2610>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 22CF125: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA Repeater/Repeater/ DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program; AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with LTD unless authorized by agent; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file) and 1 DA surcharge; 90 days MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations. 

COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit. 
Probation Review Hrg set for 10/21/2022 at 1:15 pm. 
Adj: 10:56 am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Micki. 
Case Called: 3:25 p.m.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski for ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears in person with Attorney Peter Vu for Attorney Adam Fontana. 

**COURT QUASHES WARRANT**

Atty Vu makes statement.
ADA Vechinski makes statement.
Atty Vu waives time limits.

COURT ORDERS: $1,200.00 signature bond with the same non-monetary conditions as previously ordered. Court also strikes BFH.  

NEXT DATE >>
JPTC - 8/12/22 at 10:40 a.m.

ADJ: 3:28 p.m.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:13 a.m.
Clerk:  Micki. 
   
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for ADA Rory McGarry. Defendant appears fails to appear, Attorney Adam Fontana appears in person.  
Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 

Atty Puig requests a warrant due to the defendant's non-appearance
COURT notes notice was given for today's hearing.  

COURT recesses at 9:16 a.m.
BOTR: 9:21 a.m.

Same appearances.

COURT authorizes $500.00 bench warrant.  


Next Hearing >> 
BFH - 9/23/22 at 9:00a.m.

Adj: 9:22 a.m.

cc: Branch 3.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Pre-trial conference on July 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim time limits preserved. 

PLEA:  Not Guilty on misds.

- Prints and photograph. 

BRANCH 3 CASE.
